rules.rule: Use electric blue (#00D9FF) for player/ally elements, corrupted red/orange (#FF4500) for threats, and gold (#FFD700) sparingly for moments of triumph or revelation.
rules.rationale: High contrast between player and enemy creates visual clarity in the chaos. Gold becomes precious by scarcity—reserved for crystalline moments of understanding.

rules.rule: Background must be true black (#0A0A0A) with foreground at 91% white (#E8E8E8). No grays between 20% and 85%.
rules.rationale: Eliminates muddy middle ground. Forces decisive contrast that mirrors the binary nature of survival—you're either in the light or consumed by darkness.

rules.rule: Headers use Space Grotesk at 1.414x scale increments. Body text is Inter. Code is JetBrains Mono. Never mix fonts within a component.
rules.rationale: Geometric precision in headers suggests architectural confidence. Clean separation of concerns—each typeface has its domain and doesn't trespass.

rules.rule: Line height is exactly 1.5x for body text, 1.2x for headers. Letter spacing is -0.02em for headers, 0em for body.
rules.rationale: Tight headers suggest urgency and precision. Relaxed body text allows for sustained reading during longer expositions.

rules.rule: All animations use cubic-bezier(0.16, 1, 0.3, 1) with 240ms entrance, 180ms exit, 360ms emphasis. No bouncing, elastic, or 'playful' easing.
rules.rationale: Motion feels inevitable rather than bouncy. Quick exits suggest efficiency; longer emphasis creates weight for important moments.

rules.rule: Static is default. Only animate on state change, never for decoration. Loading states pulse once per 2 seconds maximum.
rules.rationale: Motion is earned through meaning. Constant animation dilutes impact and suggests nervous energy rather than confident control.

rules.rule: Interface copy is laconic—never more than 7 words for buttons, 15 words for descriptions. Favor active voice and concrete nouns.
rules.rationale: Mirrors the war correspondent voice—efficient, precise, no wasted words when documenting a beautiful catastrophe in progress.

rules.rule: Error messages acknowledge failure without apology. Success messages are understated. Use 'terminated', 'crystallized', 'manifested' over 'deleted', 'saved', 'created'.
rules.rationale: Language choices reinforce the geometric/biological duality. Technical precision with biological undertones creates the magnificent bastard aesthetic.

rules.rule: Icons are outlined, 1.5px stroke, 2px corner radius, fitting 24px grid. Favor geometric shapes over organic curves.
rules.rationale: Geometric forms suggest systematic thinking and architectural precision—the hornet's methodical approach to constructing inevitable spectacle.

rules.rule: Player-related icons trend angular/crystalline. Enemy-related icons trend organic/corrupted. Neutral icons are perfect geometric primitives.
rules.rationale: Visual language that reinforces the core tension: geometric precision (player) versus biological corruption (threat).

examples.title: Button States
examples.description: How interactive elements reflect the vision's confident precision
examples.do: Primary button: electric blue background, 'Crystallize' label, 240ms cubic-bezier entrance on hover with 2px geometric border
examples.dont: Rounded button with bounce animation, 'Please click me!' label in cheerful green with drop shadow

examples.title: Error Handling
examples.description: How failure is acknowledged with dignity rather than apology
examples.do: Connection terminated. Retry protocol initiated. [geometric retry icon]
examples.dont: Oops! Sorry about that! Something went wrong. Please try again! 😅 [bouncing emoji]

examples.title: Data Visualization
examples.description: How information displays maintain the geometric/biological tension
examples.do: Progress bars as crystalline formations growing left-to-right. Threat indicators as pulsing organic shapes in corrupted orange.
examples.dont: Cheerful rainbow progress bars with smiley faces and gentle curved edges in pastel colors

examples.title: Loading States
examples.description: How waiting feels purposeful rather than anxious
examples.do: Single geometric shape materializing through opacity shift every 2 seconds with 'Manifesting...' label
examples.dont: Three bouncing dots with 'Loading, please wait!' and spinners rotating constantly
